com.apriori.collections

Class PriorityQueues

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.collections.PriorityQueues

  • public final class PriorityQueues
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for working with instances of PriorityQueue (not to be mistaken for PriorityQueue).

    The meat of this class includes a useful base class for value types that are stored into priority queues, and methods for adapting a priority queue to the standard Queue interface.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  PriorityQueues.AutoEntry<P,E extends PriorityQueues.AutoEntry<P,E>>
      A type of value that automatically associates itself with a queue entry when added to a PriorityQueue.
      static interface  PriorityQueues.MeldableQueue<E>
      A simple meldable ordered queue.

    • Method Detail

      • entry

        public static <E,P> PriorityQueue.Entry<E,P> entry(E element,
                                                   P priority)
        Creates a priority queue entry. This method should be used when adding items to a queue returned by asQueue(com.apriori.collections.PriorityQueue<E, P>).

        If the same element and priority are to be added to multiple queues, create multiple entries. Adding the returned entry to more than one queue will result in an IllegalStateException being thrown. Trying to remove the entry before it has actually been added to a queue will also result in an IllegalStateException being thrown.

        Parameters:
        element - the element
        priority - the priority for the given element
        Returns:
        an entry that represents the given element at the given priority

      • asQueue

        public static <E,P> OrderedQueue<PriorityQueue.Entry<E,P>> asQueue(PriorityQueue<E,P> priorityQueue)
        Returns a view of a PriorityQueue as an OrderedQueue. The entry(Object, Object) method must be used to create objects that are added to the returned queue. Otherwise, adding an entry will result in a ClassCastException.
        Parameters:
        priorityQueue - a priority queue
        Returns:
        a view of the given priority queue as a OrderedQueue

      • asQueue

        public static <E,P,Q extends MeldablePriorityQueue<E,P,Q>> PriorityQueues.MeldableQueue<PriorityQueue.Entry<E,P>> asQueue(Q priorityQueue)
        Returns a view of a MeldablePriorityQueue as a MeldableOrderedQueue. The entry(Object, Object) method must be used to create objects that are added to the returned queue. Otherwise, adding an entry will result in a ClassCastException. Attempting to meld the returned queue with another whose underlying priority queue is not actually meldable will also result in a ClassCastException.
        Parameters:
        priorityQueue - a priority queue
        Returns:
        a view of the given priority queue as a MeldableOrderedQueue
